titleStmt.title: Colchester surrendred to the Lord Generall vvith the manner of the agreement: Also a list of the names of the lords, colonells, and other officers, taken with Duke Hambleton at Utoxetor on Friday the 25 of Aug. 1648 all prisoners at mercy, by the Lord Grey. Presented to both Houses of Parliament. 5 lords taken, 2 knights, 8 collonels 7 lieutenant collonels, 13 majors, 31 captains, 43 lieutenants, 21 cornets, 20 quartermasters, 34 corporalls, 5 trumpeters, 3000 private souldiers, 3500 armes and 3000 horse.

Colchester surrendred to the Lord Generall vvith the manner of the agreement: Also a list of the names of the lords, colonells, and other officers, taken with Duke Hambleton at Utoxetor on Friday the 25 of Aug. 1648 all prisoners at mercy, by the Lord Grey. Presented to both Houses of Parliament. 5 lords taken, 2 knights, 8 collonels 7 lieutenant collonels, 13 majors, 31 captains, 43 lieutenants, 21 cornets, 20 quartermasters, 34 corporalls, 5 trumpeters, 3000 private souldiers, 3500 armes and 3000 horse.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Robert Ibbitson, in Smithfield, neer the Queenes-head Tavern,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
